Description: Fragment of a spacer-bead made of a reddish-brownish faience in a rectangular and flat shape with rounded edges. Preserved in a length of three and a half perforations with a diameter of 0.14cm. The glaze is of a good quality.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E17.2B, lowest level
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
